title: Police hunt vegan protester and angry customer who clashed in Pizza Express
text:

Police are looking to speak to a vegan protester and an angry customer who clashed with each other at a Pizza Express.

The blonde-haired woman was allegedly hit in the face by the bald-headed man during the demonstration, however she is also suspected of committing an assault later on.

She was reportedly calling for meat to be taken off the menu when she was punched by the man, who said protesters were scaring children in the Pizza Express restaurant.

The protester appears to have been part of a group who entered the premises in Brighton, East Sussex, holding up photos of animals saying "I want to live" and shouting "it's not food, it's violence".

Later in the evening the woman was said to have assaulted a male member of staff at The Opposition Cafe in Market Street by punching him in the face.

A spokesman for Sussex Police said: "Police would like to trace two people in connection with two assaults which happened during vegan protests at two restaurants in Brighton.

"Protesters went into The Opposition Cafe in Market Street on Sunday September 29 at about 7.15pm and during an altercation with staff and customers, a member of staff reported that he was punched in the face by a woman.

(Image: DxE Brighton)

(Image: DxE Brighton)

"Officers are also investigating a report that the woman suspect was also punched herself by another man at an earlier protest at Pizza Express restaurant in Royal Albert Street at about 6.15pm.

"We have released these two CCTV images of a man and a woman we would like to identify in connection with the assaults. If you recognise either of them or can help with our investigation please contact us.

"The woman has white/blonde curly hair and was wearing a dark headband and a dark coloured coat. The man is bald and was wearing a dark green/brown coloured shirt."

(Image: DxE Brighton)

(Image: DxE Brighton)

The animal rights campaigners were reportedly part of the group Direct Action Everywhere.

Various protesters held up placards advocating Rose's Law, which hopes to create an animal bill of rights.

If you have any information which could assist the investigation report online or ring 101 quoting serial 1187 of 29/09.
description: Police are looking to speak with a vegan protester and the man who confronted her in a Pizza Express in Brighton
